intro: Psychotria barbiflora var. minor, commonly known as the lesser barbed-flowered Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
